alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington County through 615 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lakeville, or 24 miles south of Danforth, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Topsfield, Grand Lake Stream, Dyer Township, Fowler Township, Baileyville, Alexander, Carroll, Waite, Dyer, Fowler and Big Lake. This includes US Highway 1 between Princeton and Waite. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Northern Washington
